Description: Jar of marl clay pottery with flat base, convex sides, short neck and everted rim. Body is decorated in red pigment with 5 vertical columns composed of 3 thick lines broken into 2 and in one case 3 segments. The paint was applied with fingers. Potmark incised post-firing at mid body.
Curator's comments: o W. M. F. Petrie, Diospolis Parva: the cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. Egypt Exploration Fund Memoir 20. (London 1901),pl. xv.D25a reproduced as Decorated ware D25a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
